job.title: Staff Software Engineer (Servicenow service portal)
job.description: <p><strong>&nbsp;Role:&nbsp;Staff Software Engineer&nbsp;</strong>(Servicenow service portal)</p><p><strong>&nbsp;Location: Santa Clara/Remote</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;Duration: Long term</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;W2 Candidate</strong></p><p><strong>This position is not open for C2C</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Must have non-negotiable</strong></p><ul><li>3+ years&nbsp;experience with Servicenow service portal.</li><li>8 years for software development experience (Front end)</li></ul><p><strong>What you'll do in this role:</strong></p><ul><li>Build high-quality, clean, scalable and reusable code by enforcing best practices around software engineering architecture and processes (Code Reviews, Unit testing, etc.)</li><li>Work with the product owners to understand detailed requirements and own your code from design, implementation, test automation and delivery of high-quality products to our users.</li><li>Design software that is simple to use to allow customers to extend and customize the functionality to meet their specific needs</li><li>Contribute to the design and implementation of new products and features while also enhancing the existing product suite</li><li>Be a mentor for colleagues and help promote knowledge-sharing</li></ul><p><strong>What you will need for this role to be successful:</strong></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience in ServiceNow’s service portal custom applications development</li><li>8 years of experience in the development of custom applications using Java, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJS, and ReactJS. (Both client and service side scripting)</li><li>Has technical knowledge building REST/SOAP-based APIs.</li><li>Deep knowledge of AJAX, JSON, HTML, XML, CSS, REST, HighCharts and associated frameworks</li><li>Understanding of dependency injection and unit-testing principles</li><li>Understanding of functional programming paradigm</li><li>Experience with relational databases and SQL</li><li>Deep understanding of design patterns</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.&nbsp;</li></ul>
